chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Edward Kluth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CF510 and 22CF668 and consecutive to any sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 1:33 PM Defendant Matthew Edward Kluth in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin W. Henry appeared by video for Matthew Edward Kluth.  Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2. Count 3 dismissed and read in. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Count 1 court orders 2 year prison, 2 years extended supervision and count 2 court orders 2 years prison, 3 years extended supervision concurrent with 22CF668 and 22CF510 and consecutive to sentence now serving. Costs DOC collect. Eligible for programs. Sentence credit 0 days
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:17 AM Defendant Matthew Edward Kluth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Justin W. Henry appeared by video for Matthew Edward Kluth.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:03 PM  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Edward Kluth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Justin W. Henry appeared by video for Matthew Edward Kluth. Preliminary hearing request within time limits by zoom.  Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 9:15.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Edward Kluth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Matthew Edward Kluth. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.M.C. or L.C.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Matter continued for attorney Justin Henry to be in court. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 3PM.
